meta.description: AI supply chain ontology (7-layer model) — Layer 4 expansion (Gemini, Claude, Anthropic) + edge updates

nodes.name: Grid Power & Datacenter Energy
nodes.description: Electricity supply, transmission, and datacenter siting constraints.

nodes.name: AMD
nodes.description: Competing accelerators (MI series); CPU + GPU; alternative to NVIDIA in some clusters.

nodes.name: Broadcom
nodes.description: Dominant networking ASIC vendor (Tomahawk, Jericho); backbone of AI cluster interconnect.

nodes.name: CoWoS
nodes.description: Advanced 2.5D/3D chip packaging used for high-end AI accelerators.

nodes.name: HBM
nodes.description: High Bandwidth Memory; critical resource for AI accelerator performance.

nodes.name: Advanced Cooling Systems
nodes.description: Liquid cooling, immersion, and thermal management systems enabling dense AI clusters.

nodes.name: Intel
nodes.description: CPUs, Gaudi accelerators; fabs; attempting relevance in AI compute.

nodes.name: Micron Technology
nodes.description: U.S.-based DRAM and NAND vendor; rapidly growing HBM supplier; emerging third pillar.

nodes.name: NVIDIA
nodes.description: AI accelerator vendor; CUDA ecosystem; HBM-intensive training hardware.

nodes.name: Samsung
nodes.description: Memory and foundry; HBM and advanced node player.

nodes.name: SK hynix
nodes.description: Leading HBM supplier; memory bottleneck for AI accelerators.

nodes.name: TPU
nodes.description: Google's in-house AI accelerator family (v4, v5, v5p) used for frontier-scale training.

nodes.name: TSMC
nodes.description: Advanced foundry and packaging; chokepoint for AI silicon.

nodes.name: AWS
nodes.description: Hyperscale cloud; Trainium/Inferentia; strong infra presence.

nodes.name: Azure
nodes.description: Microsoft cloud; cluster OS, orchestration, AI training/serving infra.

nodes.name: CUDA
nodes.description: NVIDIA software stack; developer lock-in; critical part of NVIDIA moat.

nodes.name: Google Kubernetes Engine
nodes.description: Google-managed Kubernetes and distributed AI infra stack.

nodes.name: Meta
nodes.description: Llama model family; heavy internal infra; social and ads embedding.

nodes.name: OpenAI
nodes.description: Frontier model developer tightly integrated with Azure.

nodes.name: xAI
nodes.description: Frontier-adjacent models; inference-centric architecture.

nodes.name: Gemini
nodes.description: Google’s frontier foundation model family.

nodes.name: Claude
nodes.description: Anthropic’s frontier foundation model family.

nodes.name: Anthropic
nodes.description: Frontier model developer (Claude family); major alternative to OpenAI.

nodes.name: Enterprise AI Apps
nodes.description: Vertical copilots, agents, and workflow tools embedded in enterprises.

nodes.name: Google
nodes.description: Global integrator with TPU stack, cloud infra, consumer platforms, and policy influence.

nodes.name: Microsoft
nodes.description: Hyperscaler; enterprise and government integration; Azure; institutional leverage.

nodes.name: US Regulators & Policy
nodes.description: National policy, export controls, industrial strategy.

nodes.name: Utility-Scale Power Generators
nodes.description: Large regulated power producers supplying bulk electricity to datacenters.
